summary: This is a formal Touhy request letter from the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, on behalf of their client Lola Doe, a victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The letter requests production of documentary and tangible evidence related to Lola Doe's sexual abuse by Epstein in 2002, to be used in her civil case (Lola Doe v. Darren K. Indyke, et al.). The client has declined the Epstein Victims' Compensation Fund and is proceeding to trial.

persons.name: Bradley J. Edwards
persons.context: Attorney from Edwards Pottinger LLC, signatory of the Touhy request letter on behalf of client Lola Doe.

persons.context: Attorney from Edwards Pottinger LLC, listed on the New York office letterhead.

persons.name: Lola Doe
persons.context: Pseudonym for the client, a victim of sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein in 2002 when she was a child. She is the plaintiff in the civil case and has declined the compensation fund to proceed to trial.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a prolific pedophile and rapist who sexually assaulted Lola Doe in 2002. The letter references his criminal activity involving over a hundred victims.

persons.context: Named defendant in the civil case Lola Doe v. Darren K. Indyke, et al., referenced by the case number.

connections.description: Edwards is an attorney representing Lola Doe in her civil case and is making the Touhy request on her behalf.
Henderson is an attorney representing Lola Doe, as a signatory on the request letter.
Epstein sexually assaulted Lola Doe in 2002 when she was a child, and provided her with flights, housing, and items of value.
Lola Doe is the plaintiff suing Darren K. Indyke (and others) in the referenced civil case in SDNY.

events.title: Sexual assault of Lola Doe
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein sexually assaulted Lola Doe when she was a child. He also purchased commercial flights, provided housing, and bought items of value for her.

events.title: Submission of Touhy request
events.description: Attorneys for Lola Doe submit a formal Touhy request to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY for evidence related to her abuse.

locations: 86 Chambers Street, 3rd Floor (U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY)
keyFacts: Lola Doe, a victim of Jeffrey Epstein, was sexually assaulted by him in 2002 when she was a child.
Lola Doe has declined an offer from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Fund and is proceeding to a civil trial in the Southern District of New York (Case No. 1:21-cv-03876).

The letter is a formal Touhy request (28 C.F.R. ยง 16.21 et seq.) for the government to produce evidence in its possession related to Lola Doe, including photos, videos, correspondence, and records of gifts/payments.
The request argues disclosure is appropriate and necessary for the civil proceeding, and that the law enforcement privilege is qualified and can be overcome.
Epstein's criminal behavior is described as involving over a hundred young girls and women over more than a decade.
